Are boys born loving trains and guns while girls reach for dolls and pretty pink dresses? Are boys born with various brains, enabling them throughout the features science and math, while girls naturally master literature but the written word?
As you may remember, in 2005, once president of Harvard when i bought it, Lawrence Summers, created such an uproar with disparaging comments about women's aptitude for science and math. Research has revealed that American girls around between 9 and 17 consistently had fewer experiences for the science realm than boys, and usually expressed negative perceptions and attitudes toward science and math classes.
